This DMG will install with no problems if burned to a DVD or imaged to a USB Drive and used to boot the machine from.

If you try to install from the desktop itself by running the installer from within the DMG, it may warn you that you did not purchase it, but holding down the CTRL key and then clicking the install should by pass and install just fine.
I'm sorry, I believe it is the Option key and not the CTRL key you must hold down before clicking the installer.

@casperboo

will i be able to do a clean install without having it ask for an apple id to proceed? The other torrents requires an apple id in order to do a clean install. the upgraded install works fine but i'd rather have a clean slate. thanks in advance :)

@errorofdeath7 

You can do a clean install. It won't ask for an apple id since it isn't packaged with the install app that you download from the app store. It behaved just the Snow Leopard disk. Mount click install, it does a few things, reboots finishes installing, reboots into Lion.

@errorofdeath7 

In the case of a clean install you can format a thumb drive to be a bootable clone or burn it to a dvd.
